intro: Neanotis rheedei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically features velvety, dark green leaves and produces tubular, often brightly colored blooms. Neanotis rheedei thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
